long: Meaning: (adjectively) "at home"; hence (by implication of satisfaction) "lovely"; also (noun) a "home", of God (temple), men (residence), flocks (pasture), or wild animals ("den").  Usage: comely, dwelling (place), fold, habitation, pleasant place, sheepcote, stable, tarried.  Source: or (feminine) "נָוָה"; from "H5115";
